item.title: Pokémon TCG Trademarks ‘Celebration Collection’ Ahead of 30th Anniversary
item.content:encoded:
The Pokémon Company has trademarked the name ‘Celebration Collection’ in Japan, under full English, in the same terms as trademarks have been previously used for set names.

2026 marks the 30th anniversary of the Pokémon franchise, with the history of the TCG likely to be referenced in a special set, and it appears the name for next year’s anniversary set has been unveiled.

Celebration Collection Trademarked by Pokémon

Revealed by Pokebeach, the trademark of Celebration Collection hints at what a holiday set in mid-2026 could entail, suggesting that a similar path to 2021’s Celebrations may be followed.

Celebrations had a main set of holo cards featuring a 25th anniversary stamp, alongside a subset of classic cards from the TCG reprinted with the same anniversary stamp—including the likes of Charizard, Blastoise, and Venusaur from Base Set.

It’s not clear yet whether a similar approach will be followed in 2026, but it’s pretty much a guarantee there will be an anniversary set of some kind based on Pokémon’s history with previous anniversaries.

In 2016, for the 20th anniversary of the Pokémon franchise, the TCG introduced the Generations set and XY Evolutions, a reprint of Base Set, along with several stamped promo cards featuring the 20th anniversary logo.

No release window for Celebration Collection has been stated, though the standard format for the TCG means it’s likely to come in mid-2026 in English as the second holiday set of the year, following on from Ascended Heroes.

Japan, as always, will see the set released first, but there are several TCG sets on the agenda before Celebration Collection emerges on the scene, with trademarks uncovered for Munikis Zero, Ninja Spinner, Storm Emeralda, and Abyss Eye—expected to showcase the likes of Mega Zygarde, Mega Greninja, Mega Rayquaza, and Darkrai.

What do you want to see in the Pokémon TCG for the 30th anniversary? Share your thoughts with other collectors in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out the secret rares coming to Ascended Heroes, and mull over the list of the best holiday gifts for Pokémon fans.

item.title: Pokémon Ascended Heroes Secret Rares Revealed in Japan’s Mega Dream ex
item.content:encoded:
Excitement levels continue to rise for the Pokémon TCG’s Ascended Heroes holiday set, due to release early next year, and more card reveals have emerged in Japan’s Mega Dream ex.

Mega Dream ex is the Japanese version of the Ascended Heroes set, and releases on Friday, November 28, with the majority of the cards included combining with new cards in the Start Deck 100, releasing next month, to create the Ascended Heroes set list—and the biggest chase cards have now been revealed.

Mega Dream ex Secret Rares Revealed

As reported by the likes of Pokebeach, Mega Dream ex features 20 Art Rares and a new card rarity, Mega Attack Rare, which are drawn in a comic book style. The Japanese set has English words in the text, while the English set will feature Japanese writing.

The reveal of the Ascended Heroes set has already stated there will be “more than 30” Pokémon and Trainer cards with special illustrations, with the set highlighted by the likes of Mega Gengar, Mega Dragonite, and the return of Trainer’s Pokémon that were initially brought back to the TCG in Journey Together earlier this year.

While the Mega Dream ex Secret Rares drop a major hint of what the Ascended Heroes set will include, not every card will be included, with some likely to be pulled to feature as promo cards, and they could be cut entirely and used to increase the number of cards in a future set.

For example, N’s Zekrom is an Art Rare in Japan’s Mega Dream ex, but is featured as the promo card in the Ascended Heroes Elite Trainer Box.

The table below highlights all of the revealed cards for Mega Dream ex, their set number, and the card type.

What is your chase card going to be in Mega Dream ex and Ascended Heroes? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out the best holiday gifts for Pokémon fans, and take a look at the release date details for the Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mega Dimension DLC.

item.title: Envy is The Third Major Team Pulling Out of Marvel Rivals Esports
item.content:encoded:
Envy has become the third major organisation to pull out of Marvel Rivals’ Esports scene, with an announcement stating a decision to pause “competitive operations in Marvel Rivals.”

Marvel Rivals’ Esports scene has grown significantly in the year since launch, with competition including the Ignite Mid-Season Finals in Guangzhou, China, offering a $500,000 prize pool, but the scene has been hit by the departure of major teams in recent months.

Envy Follows Sentinels, 100 Thieves Out of Marvel Rivals

In a statement on Twitter, Envy’s decision to halt operations in Marvel Rivals Esports was confirmed, but, similarly to the Sentinels, the door has been left open for a return in the future.

The statement read: “Today, we’re announcing that we will be pausing our competitive operations in Marvel Rivals. We’re incredibly proud of the effort and passion our roster brought to the game, and grateful for what we were able to build together during our time in the scene.

“As of today, all our players are free to explore new opportunities, and we wish each of them success in what comes next. As the Marvel Rivals competitive ecosystem develops, we hope to see the return of Envy Rivals.”

With Envy, Sentinels, and 100 Thieves all announcing their exit from the Rivals Esports scene, which comes free of the Ignite Grand Finals in Atlanta that culminated earlier this month, there is major uncertainty about the future heading into the second year of Esports competition.

NetEase have not commented on the departures from the Esports scene, but a recent post on the official Twitter account of Marvel Rivals Esports said 2025 was “just the beginning,” and that “in 2026, that spark becomes something even greater.”

What do you think the future of Marvel Rivals Esports holds? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Marvel Rivals, check out how to get free Winter Soldier cosmetics, and take a look at the latest patch notes for the game.

item.title: NYT Connections Hints Today (#899)—Clues and Answers for Wednesday, November 26
item.content:encoded:
It’s time for a bit of midweek madness; hopefully, your streak can keep up with today’s NYT Connections puzzle! That’s right, I’m here with the latest NYT Connections hints to get you through this midweek lull and keep pushing towards the inevitable weekend. It’s almost the festive window, but for now, we’ll wait to celebrate until you’ve smashed today’s puzzle.

Read on for today’s NYT Connections hints and solutions.

What is NYT Connections?

It would be remiss of me not to give a little foundational backstory before leaping into today’s NYT Connections clues and hints.

In June 2023, NYT Connections emerged as yet another game in the ever-growing New York Times lineup. This title soared immediately, and it’s easy to see why. As a free-to-play, accessible New York Times game, NYT Connections is available to users worldwide and can be played on either desktop devices or via a mobile app.

Playing NYT Connections on your commute or while waiting for a coffee is a fantastic way to kill a few minutes.

But how do you play NYT Connections?

It’s relatively simple, and that’s why it’s the best New York Times game, in my opinion.

The NYT team will provide you with a grid of 16 words once a day. The only task left up to you is to sort those words into four groups of four by finding their commonalities. Every NYT Connections puzzle has just one solution, and some words might have a double meaning, so it can sometimes be tricky to figure out the answers.

It’s also important to stress that the words are color-coded: yellow, blue, green, and purple. That’s in order of difficulty from least to most difficult, too.

What’s critical here is that you get four guesses every day, and if you use those, your NYT Connections answers for today will be out of reach, as it’ll be game over.

Today’s NYT Connections Hints (November 26)

If you want to figure out today’s NYT Connections clues without getting the answers outright, I’ll start with the words themselves. Perhaps just seeing the words here will spur your brain into action, and you’ll spot the trends immediately.

Here are the NYT Connections words from today’s puzzle, #899:

  • CAN
  • DEB
  • COULD
  • JAN
  • MAY
  • KAT
  • MIGHT
  • SUE
  • APR
  • FLOW
  • CFO
  • GOD
  • IRA
  • MAR
  • SEC
  • TAB

And here are the hints I can offer for today’s NYT Connections:

  • Yellow – Words that hedge or allow something, often before a main verb.
  • Green – Common nicknames that stand in for longer given names.
  • Blue – You’ll see these on statements, filings, and in boardrooms.
  • Purple – Animals that feel a little backwards,

Here’s the final warning before we get to the NYT Connections answers for today, November 26:

Are you sure you want to scroll further?

Very well!

NYT Connections Answers for Today, November 26 (#899)

If you want to jump straight to the answers for today’s NYT Connections puzzle, I’ve got you covered:

  • Yellow – CAN, COULD, MAY, MIGHT
  • Green – DEB, JAN, KAT, SUE
  • Blue – APR, CFO, IRA, SEC
  • Purple – FLOW, GOD, MAR, TAB

When Does NYT Connections Reset?

That’s today’s puzzle, but if you want the next one, the game resets daily at midnight local time (that’s your local time). You’ll have 24 hours to complete the puzzle when midnight ticks over in your timezone.

How did you do? Did you get a perfect run? Let me know what your streak looks like on the Insider Gaming Discord server

item.title: Leaker Claims Destiny 3 Is In Development
item.content:encoded:
According to a credible leaker on Twitter, Destiny 3 is currently in development at Bungie. While not much is said, it seems the project is very early in the process.

The Destiny series is a much newer franchise, starting in 2014. It received plenty of acclaim for its great FPS gameplay and multiplayer aspects. Then, in 2017, Destiny 2 was released and has become one of Bungie’s biggest games. Even today, the game continues to get new updates and expansions, including with Star Wars.

While it hasn’t been without controversy, like the recent copyright lawsuit, fans still flock to the titles for a good time with friends for raids and such. Bungie is currently working on Marathon, set to release in 2026, but, as one credible source posted on social media, the company is returning to the space opera once again.

Destiny 3 In Early Development, Claims Credible Bungie Leaker

The claim in question comes from Twitter user Colony Deaks. In previous years, the insider has leaked several Bungie-related information regarding Destiny and Marathon. In the tweet, they state,

Yes, Destiny 3 is in extremely early development.

Some of you may have seen a tweet early this afternoon that mentioned that. We have been sitting on the info for a few weeks now and wanted to wait to talk about this seeing as it is in such an early state, and it just sucks to see others post about it carelessly for free internet points.

We plan to share more info in the coming months as we wait on the larger scale things to develop and take shape. Sit tight.

Despite their credibility, there has been no official confirmation from Bungie, so take the leak with a big grain of salt. It’s also important to note that, since the project is claimed to be in early development, there’s no telling just how far it is.

Sometimes, early development is story building or maybe just even a pitch board. Even still, likely, it’s likely that fans won’t hear much about a possible Destiny 3 for a long time, even if the leak is true. Regardless, it would be nice to see a new Destiny done for newer consoles and with all the new advancements.

What do you think of the Destiny 3 leak? Do you think Bungie is working on it? When do you think it’ll come out? Leave your thoughts down in the comments and in the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Bungie coverage, read these articles on the CEO stepping down and studio integration into PlayStation. Don’t forget to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Death Stranding 2 PC Port Leaked Ahead of Announcement
item.content:encoded:
A PC port of Death Stranding 2: On The Beach has leaked ahead of any official announcement. The leak comes from an ESRB rating, which has been registered for Windows PC.

As one of 2025’s best titles, Death Stranding 2: On The Beach continues the legacy of the original 2019 Death Stranding. Crafted by Kojima Productions for PlayStation, the ‘Strand’ game has taken players cross-country delivering packages and building back a broken world. The sequel has garnered much acclaim for its storytelling, music, and direction by Hideo Kojima of Metal Gear fame. At The Game Awards 2025, the title is up for Game of the Year, as well as six other categories. While only available for PlayStation 5, it seems it’s coming to PC, if the ESRB is anything to go by.

A PC Port of Death Stranding 2: On The Beach Has Been Leaked by the ESRB

As mentioned above, the official ESRB site has leaked a Windows PC version of Death Stranding 2: On The Beach. No official announcement of a PC port has come out yet, making this a pretty huge leak. Still, until then, take it with a grain of salt. Its rating, M (Mature), matches its PS5 counterpart. The description for its rating also includes some in-depth references, like the guitar weapon and robotic samurai. As of writing, the page has not been taken down.

The original Death Stranding didn’t go to PC until July 2020, a few months after its first release. With it being rated, it’s likely that Death Stranding 2 is coming to Windows PC sooner than we thought. Interestingly enough, The Game Awards are in two weeks, so perhaps Kojima was planning to reveal it there. Either way, the leak seems rather legit and, if true, means players will get to play one of the year’s best titles in a whole new way.

What do you think of Death Stranding 2’s PC leak? Do you think it’s legit? When do you think it’ll be announced? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Kojima, check out our articles on Physint’s development and OD’s scary new trailer. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Nintendo Adding Four Classic Games To Switch Online
item.content:encoded:
Four iconic NES and Game Boy games are coming to Nintendo Switch Online’s Classics catalog for November 2025. Two of them, in particular, are some deep-cut, difficult titles.

As a benefit of Nintendo Switch Online, the Classics catalog offers many nostalgic games from Nintendo’s past. There are plenty of titles to choose from, like Donkey Kong and Metroid 2: Return of Samus. While the Expansion Pack adds Nintendo 64 titles like Luigi’s Mansion, there’s still plenty of new additions to the base catalog. Now, there are some iconic games making their way to the Classics lineup that are sure to unlock some fun (and frustrating) memories.

Battletoads, Kid Icarus Coming to Nintendo Switch Online Tomorrow

In the video, shown above, we see four nostalgic games coming to the Nintendo Switch Online Classics Catalog for November 2025. Those games are Battletoads, Ninja Gaiden 2: The Dark Sword of Chaos, Bionic Commando, and Kid Icarus: Of Myths and Monsters. The titles will be available starting tomorrow, November 26th, for all Nintendo Switch Online players.

If you were an avid Nintendo fan in the 1990s, you know how difficult Ninja Gaiden 2 and Battletoads are. The iconic Turbo Tunnel level in Battletoads has left many with good and bad memories, depending on perspective. For Capcom lovers, Bionic Commando is a welcome sight, as the last time we saw the series was 2009’s controversial reboot. Then, Kid Icarus, who has yet to get another entry since 2012’s Uprising, can now complement the original, which Of Myth and Monsters is a sequel to.

What do you think of the new November 2025 Nintendo Switch Online lineup? Any games you remember from back in the day? Excited to try them out? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more Nintendo, check out our articles on The Super Mario Galaxy Movie and Pokémon: Legends Z-A DLC. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!
